comment: PROFESSOR WAS VERY ORGANIZED DURING SUMMER ONLINE CLASS. THERE WERE READINGS BUT JUST SCAN THROUGH IT TO ANSWER QUESTIONS. 2 TEST, 1 BEING HTE FINAL. DISCUSSION POST EVERY WEEK (FAST PACED BUT EASY). TAKE IF YOU WANT AN EASY A BUT MAKE SURE YOU DO HER WORK.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: There's 2 major grades: the point log and the group project. Don't get behind on the point log. If you're like me and get stuck with a bad group, you either have to deal or do it alone. By the time I gave up and decided to go alone I was too far behind and had to just drop the class. He was understanding at least, but I felt ignored and unsupported
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: If you can take this class with him do it! He is really nice and funny and makes the class interesting. He was always available for help and really cared about how you did in the class and wants you to succeed. This class has a decent amount of writing but he breaks it down so it is easy and understandable. Great professor!

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!! During the last week of class, we only had 2 grades in and had no idea where we stood. The tests are super hard and are worth a lot of your final grade. He will not reply to emails, but if he does then he won't answer the question you asked. He will make directions on assignments unclear and then fail you on them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor. This class consisted of two project two tests and 3 extra credit. He takes attendance everyday but gives 3 absences before it affects your grade and there was many times that class was done at home. He is very well spoken and is very clear on what he wants done for the projects. Tests aren't easy but provides study guides.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I took this class in the summer which means it was 2 times faster than a regular Fall/Spring semester. I found his class enjoyable and super simple to understand. There are only 2 tests with 1 being your final. He is really good on feedback and how you can improve on your discussion posts.

One of the best professors at KSU. Super funny, very engaging lecturer, and an overall great guy. This class is not too difficult and as long as you give it your best, you will be just fine. He will always be there to help you!

Dr. A is a very funny and caring professor. His tests are hard but if you do the study guide and review the material you will do fine. He grades papers fairly. Grade is based on one research paper, two tests, attendance, and one statistic exercise. You do not need to know how statistics works to do the exercise.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Amazing professor! Ive had 8 of his classes. He knows what he is talking about and cares about his students. Very easy to talk to and contact out of class. Attending class is fun and interesting.

The 4 week summer semester online class was ridiculous. There are synchrnonous classed Monday and Wednesday, and you have a lot of exercises to complete. The lectures are okay, but he tends to veer off topic easily. He gives you ONE HOUR to answer a 40+ question test, and it is only offered one time. This definitely needs to stay a F2F class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The best professor ever. When I petitioned to graduate & they asked what professor made the biggest impact during my 4 years, I chose him. Clear expectation & nothing you can't achieve with some effort. But what I really love is how caring he is. He is kind to everyone and understanding of everyone's situation. A class you can get an A in for sure.

Even in the confusion of a global pandemic, Dr. Aust continues to be one of the best professors I have ever had. His classes are extremely well organized, so keeping up with work is easy. Office hours are reliable, and Aust will bend over backwards to help you understand material. If you are an OrgCom major, you owe it to yourself to take this prof

COM3435 is tough and it will be no matter who you take it with. However, Dr. Aust did a great job of easing the burden and providing feedback. Fill out the study guide and print all ppts for reference on tests. Trust me. He has you fill out a participation point log to submit instead of checking off each assignment, so remember to do that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He's so great! Lots of small assignments, 3 tests that are super easy, and 2 major assignments. He's a lenient grader, too. Also very accesible with questions you have! I took him back in the spring and needed a class with him again!

Dr. Aust is one of the best professors I've ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and is really a nice guy overall. This is my second class with him, and I would take more with him too. There's 3 tests, discussion posts weekly, plus two more assignments due at the end of the semester. Dr. Aust sets you up to succeed. Take this class!

Dr. Aust is awesome. There are a lot of assignments, but completely doable. His tests are pretty hard so DO the study guides. He's also so incredibly caring and even took the time to work with me when I was unable to attend classes for half the semester, but wanted to continue participating. Highly recommend, one of my favor professors!!

Dr. Aust is the best professor I've ever had and i've taken him for like 5 classes. I made this account specifically to give him a review. Once you figure out how his class flows, its no problem. 2 participation point assignments each week, 4 exams, and a participation log is all you're graded on. Hes a super personable guy. Take him.

Professor Aust is a good guy and a decent professor, but he teaches at a very quick pace and expects students to follow along. Tests are difficult but fair. He uses an arbitrary "participation point log" that students must record all assignments in rather than grading individual assignments themselves.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Dr. Aust was very helpful and nice, however, he moved at a very fast pace during lectures. His tests are very difficult but if you give yourself lots of time to study you'll be fine. Sometimes he doesn't remember what he says in class which resulted in me getting a B instead of an A. Just keep organized and you'll be great.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This guy is a great speaker. His classes are really fun, and you'll look forward to going to them. Beware of the tests. The tests contain a lot of material as well as short answer sections, and they're very difficult. I suggest reviewing the study guide material multiple times until you know everything.
Really wants his students to succeed. Absolutely loved having him as my professor. Hate writing papers but he is a fair grader and works with all of his students! Would take again 88249 times

Ive had Dr. Aust for a few classes now and he is great! He makes the course content relate to real world situations, and we even get to watch episodes of the office for assignments. Plenty of coursework, but it isn't hard.

Dr. Aust is a really cool guy. I took his hybrid, and I enjoyed the face to face better than the online. He does a Participation Point Log and it is worth 100 points of your grade. The work can seem to be overwhelming but it is not hard, just time consuming. His tests are extremely hard and originate from the book.
Be prepared to print A LOT! He is an excellent professor who will help you whenever you need it. Lots of outside work especially in the hybrid class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: One of the best professors I've taken at KSU. While he has high expectations of his students, he also gives a lot of opportunities for good work. His course is difficult work-wise, but I would certainly take him again.

Ive had him for 3 semesters and he never fails to be the best teacher Ive had at Kennesaw. He works with you and helps you to grow in the subject of communication. Towards the end of the semester he gives you chances for bonus point and really does care about you and your grade!!

Dr. Aust was the nicest professor I've had. I struggled a great deal on exams, yet emailed him and he worked hard on getting me the grade I deserved. His tests are tough, but he makes class fun. I enjoyed his class, and I am grateful for how understanding he was.

Prof Aust genuinely wants to help students learn. This class is a hybrid and he facilitated as much information as he could. Lots of participation assignments but only 10 of the 12 chapters are graded. Tests are hard but he gives extensive study guides and hints to the essay portions of the tests. Lectures aren't amazing but aren't terrible.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This class is hard but if you show up and READ THE TEXTBOOK CHAPTERS you can make an A! Don't bother with the study guides- just pick up the textbook, read through the chapters and annotate! I definitely had to earn that A but it wasn't impossible. And beware if you miss class you could miss a lot of easy extra credit points! Good luck :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I gave this class my all. I put in my best effort and didn't receive an A. He makes this class extremely hard for no reason & it's an intro course. Nice guy, but takes it way to seriously. If you want to make good grades don't take this class, it'll depress you
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I had Prof. Aust for Intercultural Com. as a Maymester. He is wonderful! He makes going to class everyday for 4 1/2 hours for 2 weeks fun! His test can be hard so read the chapters and do the study guide. His grades for this class were 3 exams, participation log, and  a reading log (answer 3 short questions for each chapter). Take him!!!
Great professor! Made organizational communications extremely interesting and relevant. Beware of tests! Tests are challenging, do the study guide & start prepping early.

AMAZING professor. You can tell that he really wants his students to succeed. I took him for the 4-week course and that was a ton of work. LOTS of reading. Test are OK as long as you do the study guide. Make sure to do the extra credit. Keep up on all of the assignments. DO THE PARTICIPATION LOG ALONG THE WAY.

Took him for a 4-week course. LOTS OF WORK! Tests are tough! Despite the workload, he's an amazing professor! Make sure to keep up with participation log and remain organized; this will be a big chunk of your grade. Provides extra credit, take advantage of it. It may save you if you're not doing too well on his other assignments.

One of the best. His work load can be a lot if you do not keep up with it over the semester. His tests are hard but if you pay attention and do his study guides along the way you will pass the tests. Essay questions are given before the test so you have time to plan what you want to say. He gives lots of great feedback on projects and papers

I LOVE Dr. Aust!!! I took him for every course he taught at KSU. He is an amazing professor!!! His tests are difficult but it is worth it to be in his class. You will learn so much from him and be able to apply it in real life. Keep track of the participation point log throughout the semester or you'll be kicking yourself in the behind at the end!
Very helpful, Tests are hard but he has a great mood in the classroom. He requires a portfolio at the end of semester with all your homework in it.

Took as hybrid, very interesting. Tests are HARD! He is clear about how to study and in what order, so don't procrastinate. A lot of theories to remember but subject is fun. Two papers for not a lot of points, and strict grader, but trying to prepare communications majors to write well, so you do learn, which is a good thing. He is very fair.

He is a great teacher!!! I looked forward to his class every week. In-class discussions were great and entertaining! His test are HARD, you are forewarned but he is such a great teacher that its worth it. Show up to class (not mandatory), do your assignments, and READ, READ, READ!!!

Awesome professor. I was dreading this class because the subject matter is really dry and boring. He is very helpful and answers all questions clearly. He is also very nice and is easy to approach. Take him!

I've taken Aust for Research Methods, Interpersonal COM, and leadership COM.  He is hands down my favorite professor at KSU! He is extremely helpful and provides all his powerpoints online.  The tests are difficult, but he provides a study guide as early as 2 weeks before the test.  He really does try to make the material as interesting as possible
Nice professor.  Will go out of his way to help you.  Test are HARD (for no reason).  He makes class as interesting as he can.  I'd definitely take him again.

Dr. Aust is an amazing professor!! His tests are super hard but he is willing to work with everyone to make them easier. He makes class so much fun, it's like a therapy session!! Love him. You have to work for your grade though
Dr. Aust is a very good professor.  Come to class, listen and read and you will pass.  He keeps things interesting.
AWESOMELY AWESOME!!!!!

I LOVED this class. It was so interesting, he kept students engaged. His teaching style is very laid back. Test aren't difficult at all if you complete the study guide as you go. I would recommend him to anyone!
I really enjoyed his class. His style of teaching is very unique and clear. real world example type stuff. Would def take him if you get the chance

Amazing teacher! Com research is a very dry subject and he still found a way to make it interesting and clear. Make sure to read the chapters and you will do great. He is helpful and always happy to take the time to answer any question.
Dr. Aust was an awesome professor! A lot of research for the class but he always had answers and explained eveything thoroughly! Great sense of humor! One of my favorites

This professor is awesome!   This is not a easy A, but if you study you will do well.  His test consists of multiple choice, T/F, essay and situational questions.  There are 2 writing (APA Standards).  He expects college level papers (not bad thing).  You must come to class.  He is fun, fair and interesting.  This was my favorite class!
He is the best teacher out there.  He's really funny and and will motivate anyone to work hard.  I would say he's one of the best professor's i've ever had!!  Outstanding!!!
prepared, professional, and relaxed; make sure you read the text; his tests are challenging

Like content of class & Dr. Aust is really nice & helpful. Way 2 much paper needed 2 be printed 4 Majr Assgnmnt II tho, really a waste of trees. Also takes off points 4 every writing mistake, so be mindful. Tests r not easy. But overall good class & he teaches you a lot.

Really nice guy but 2 many weekly assignments during class where major project to audit a company. That's a hard project, especially the analysis. Gives sum time off 2 focus on audit but not enuff. Also takes off lots of points 4 every writing mistake u can think of, so be mindful. Tests r not easy. He teaches you alot of good content though.

this class was taken on-line over the summer.  many assignments and quizzes due every week, along with group work, which makes it interesting as an on-line class...  like someone else had posted, make sure you ask questions about how or where he wants something.  it will bite you back if you assume. not really a good on-line class.

Dr. Aust is great!  He isnt always really clear about what he wants so ASK a lot of questions before an assignment.  He is picky about fonts, colors and little things matching on projects.  He will always help you if you ask him.  He expects great writing.
No Comments

Dr. Aust can be pretty dorky,  but he has heart and a passion for what he does. He makes you want to learn the material. He's not easy by any means, but he's helpful, thoughtful and makes you want to learn what he has to say.   I give him 10 out of 10

Great teacher. Lectures each class, but keeps it entertaining since the subject matter is so boring. A couple projects which are easy ifyou follow all the guidelines, and quizzes and tests. Gives out straight forward study guides for the tests. Must attend class bc of participation grades.
